Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may stop your vehicle if there are no buses coming
You may stop your vehicle between 6pm and 8am except on Fridays and Saturdays
You may stop your vehicle if someone stays with it
You may not stop your vehicle at any time

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

When must you turn your vehicle headlights on?

Answers.Answer: 15 minutes after sunset until 15 minutes before sunrise
30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise
45 minutes after sunset until 45 minutes before sunrise

Question: On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party

Answer the call at the next set of traffic signals

Pull over and stop to use the cellphone when it is safe to do so

Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door

Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you are turning left at an intersection, you must give way to vehicles coming towards you that are turning right.

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear
